comments:
I had my default editor for .java files as AspectJ/Java. In the most recent dev build of AJDT, if I try to open a .java file in a Java project, I get this stack trace. I could only fix this by changing the default editor to be the Java editor and restarting Eclipse. Interestingly I did NOT have an option to open with an alternative editor. This is for AJDT build 20060324064654

java.lang.ClassCastException: org.eclipse.jface.text.source.AnnotationModel

Note that it's still important to be able to use AspectJ editor for .java files in AJDT if you ever do things like call ITD methods, invoke aspectOf, import an aspect type, etc. Alternatively, the right strategy would be to have ALL Java types be created in a .aj file in an AspectJ project (which would be the purist answer but a disaster for adoption)!
This looks similar to bug 129927. It seems to be intermittent - maybe a timing window at startup. I haven't seen it myself (and I can use the aj editor for .java files) but a number of people have.

Interesting. I also saw this only on upgrading to the latest milestone build, it didn't happen in the earlier one. It also isn't consistent: I just changed my preferences to again make AspectJ the default editor for Java files and it is working again, even in a Java (not AspectJ) project...
Please reopen if you see this again with recent eclipse builds
